Sentencas: The conventional solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode, which consists of metallic Ni and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ), is liable to deactivation when a carbon-containing gaseous fuel is directly supplied.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability

Sentencas: To retard the degradation due to a direct supply of CH4, the Ni/YSZ has been modified with the incorporation of Co into the Ni matrix, forming a substitutional solid-solution alloy.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability

Sentencas: As a result, the porous anode exhibits well-connected compositional grains owing to the Co3O4 precursor as a sintering aid.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability

Sentencas: The 25 mol% Co incorporation producing the Ni0.75Co0.25/YSZ anode significantly improves the cell performance and prolonged stability.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability

Sentencas: In addition, the Ni0.75Co0.25/YSZ anode provides the apparent activation energy of the charge transfer reaction to a lower value in the electrochemical oxidation of CH4 at the triple-phase boundary.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability

Sentencas: However, the apparent activation energy decrease is not identified for H2.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability

Sentencas: The Co alloying effect on catalyzing the electrochemical oxidation of CH4 is caused by suppressing the carbon deposition originating from the thermal dissociation of adsorbed CH4 on the Ni1-xCox alloy surface.
Titulo: Anodic polarization characteristics in hydrogen and methane oxidations at nickel-cobalt yttria-stabilized zirconia cermet relating to prolonged cell performance stability
